thread.title: 'Me and Earl and the Dying Girl' Actor Signs On for 'Power Rangers'
thread.title_full: 'Me and Earl and the Dying Girl' Actor Signs On for 'Power Rangers'

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: 'Me and Earl and the Dying Girl' Actor Signs On for 'Power Rangers'
text:
Comments RJ Cyler has signed up to star in Lionsgate's 'Power Rangers', joining previously-announced actors Ludi Lin and Naomi Scott. 
RJ Cyler has officially joined the cast of Lionsgate's " Power Rangers ". The official Instagram account of the movie has announced that the 20-year-old actor is on board to play Billy a.k.a. the Blue Power Ranger. Cyler will star alongside the recently-announced cast members, Ludi Lin, who is on board to star as Zack a.k.a. the Black Ranger, Dacre Montgomery, who will portray Jason a.k.a. the Red Ranger, and Naomi Scott, who will play Kimberly a.k.a. the Pink Ranger. A photo posted by Power Rangers (@powerrangersmovie) on Oct 23, 2015 at 9:01am PDT Zack Stentz and Ashley Miller, who both penned the script of " X-Men: First Class " and " Thor ", wrote the screenplay for "Power Rangers", which Israeli has described as "a really cool, contemporary, mature but still playful, buoyant and fun take on the material." The upcoming movie is based on '90s TV series, "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers", in which a group of ordinary high school kids, who possess extraterrestrial powers, join forces to save the world, with the aid of giant mechanical vehicles known as Zords. It is due to hit U.S. theaters on January 13, 2017. Cyler's recent credit was " Me & Earl & the Dying Girl ", in which he made an impressive performance as the main character's best friend. He will next be seen in " War Machine " alongside Brad Pitt and on HBO's comedy series " Vice Principals ".
